content.description:
Upsuck climbs a short, lowball overhang on great rock over a very good landing. The movement is delightfully brutish on this one.

Sit start with a right hand pinch and a left hand undercling/sidepull. From there, bump the left hand further up the feature to a decent thumb-catch, walk the feet through the foot-slip potential smears to a big power foot, then make a big right hand move to a pinch/edge (using an intermediate sidepull may be an option as well), reach a left hand three-finger pocket, gain the lip, and top it out using the good features (not a bad idea to check for glass before throwing your hands around up there).
content.protection: A pad will suffice, the landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the center, north face of Captain Crunch (the northwest arete is off - though it climbs purely without it).

content.description: Sit start with a sharp, crimpy undercling and pull up (perhaps with a grunt) to a nice, sharp hold with the right hand, then work the left up to an obvious hold, and then work the top out slightly to the right of the crack or go a little left for a more challenging top out.
